007package renderer.models_TP;
008
009import renderer.scene.*;
010import renderer.scene.primitives.*;
011import renderer.scene.util.MeshMaker_TP;
012import renderer.scene.util.MeshType;
013
014/**
015   Create a solid model of a frustum of a right circular cone
016   with its base in the xz-plane.
017<p>
018   See <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frustum" target="_top">
019                https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frustum</a>
020
021   @see Cone
022   @see ConeSector
023*/
024public class ConeFrustum extends Model implements MeshMaker_TP
025{
026   public final double r1;
027   public final double r2;
028   public final double h;
029   public final int n;
030   public final int k;
031   public final MeshType type;
032
033   /**
034      Create a frustum of a right circular cone with its base in the
035      xz-plane, a base radius of 1, top radius of 1/2, and height 1/2.
036   */
037   public ConeFrustum( )
038   {
039      this(1.0, 0.5, 0.5, 7, 16);
040   }
041
042
043   /**
044      Create a frustum of a right circular cone with its base in the
045      xz-plane, a base radius of {@code r}, top of the frustum at
046      height {@code h}, and with the cone's apex on the y-axis at
047      height {@code a}.
048   <p>
049      There must be at least three lines of longitude and at least
050      two circles of latitude.
051
052      @param n  number of circles of latitude
053      @param k  number of lines of longitude
054      @param r  radius of the base in the xz-plane
055      @param h  height of the frustum
056      @param a  height of the apex of the cone
057      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code n} is less than 2
058      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code k} is less than 3
059   */
060   public ConeFrustum(final int n, final int k,
061                      final double r, final double h, final double a)
062   {
063      this(r, h, (1 - h/a)*r, n, k);
064   }
065
066
067   /**
068      Create a frustum of a right circular cone with its base in the
069      xz-plane, a base radius of {@code r1}, top radius of {@code r2},
070      and height {@code h}.
071   <p>
072      This model works with either {@code r1 > r2} or {@code r1 < r2}.
073      In other words, the frustum can have its "apex" either above or
074      below the xz-plane.
075   <p>
076      There must be at least three lines of longitude and at least
077      two circles of latitude.
078
079      @param r1  radius of the base of the frustum
080      @param h   height of the frustum
081      @param r2  radius of the top of the frustum
082      @param n   number of circles of latitude
083      @param k   number of lines of longitude
084      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code n} is less than 2
085      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code k} is less than 3
086   */
087   public ConeFrustum(double r1, double h, double r2, int n, int k)
088   {
089      this(r1, h, r2, n, k, MeshType.HORIZONTAL);
090   }
091
092
093   /**
094      Create a frustum of a right circular cone with its base in the
095      xz-plane, a base radius of {@code r1}, top radius of {@code r2},
096      and height {@code h}.
097   <p>
098      This model works with either {@code r1 > r2} or {@code r1 < r2}.
099      In other words, the frustum can have its "apex" either above or
100      below the xz-plane.
101   <p>
102      There must be at least three lines of longitude and at least
103      two circles of latitude.
104
105      @param r1  radius of the base of the frustum
106      @param h   height of the frustum
107      @param r2  radius of the top of the frustum
108      @param n   number of circles of latitude
109      @param k   number of lines of longitude
110      @param type  choose between horizoantal, vertical, and checkerboard triangle strips
111      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code n} is less than 2
112      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code k} is less than 3
113   */
114   public ConeFrustum(final double r1, final double h, final double r2,
115                      final int n, final int k,
116                      final MeshType type)
117   {
118      super(String.format("Cone Frustum(%.2f,%.2f,%.2f,%d,%d)",
119                                        r1,  h,   r2,  n, k));
120
121      if (n < 2)
122         throw new IllegalArgumentException("n must be greater than 1");
123      if (k < 3)
124         throw new IllegalArgumentException("k must be greater than 2");
125
126      this.r1 = r1;
127      this.r2 = r2;
128      this.h = h;
129      this.n = n;
130      this.k = k;
131      this.type = type;
132
133      // Create the frustum's geometry.
134
135      final double deltaH = h / (n - 1),
136                   deltaTheta = (2.0 * Math.PI) / k;
137
138      // An array of vertices to be used to create triangles.
139      final Vertex[][] v = new Vertex[n][k];
140
141      // Create all the vertices.
142      for (int j = 0; j < k; ++j) // choose an angle of longitude
143      {
144         final double c = Math.cos(j * deltaTheta),
145                      s = Math.sin(j * deltaTheta);
146         for (int i = 0; i < n; ++i) // choose a circle of latitude
147         {
148            final double slantRadius = (i/(n - 1.0)) * r1 + (1.0 - i/(n - 1.0)) * r2;
149            v[i][j] = new Vertex(slantRadius * c,
150                                 h - i * deltaH,
151                                 slantRadius * s );
152         }
153      }
154      final Vertex topCenter = new Vertex(0, h, 0),
155                bottomCenter = new Vertex(0, 0, 0);
156
157      // Add all of the vertices to this model.
158      for (int i = 0; i < n; ++i)
159      {
160         for (int j = 0; j < k; ++j)
161         {
162            addVertex( v[i][j] );
163         }
164      }
165      addVertex(topCenter,
166                bottomCenter);
167      final int topCenterIndex = n * k,
168                bottomCenterIndex = topCenterIndex + 1;
169
170
171      // Create all the triangle strips along the cone wall.
172      if (MeshType.HORIZONTAL == type)
173      {
174         for (int i = 0; i < n - 1; ++i) // choose a circle of latitude
175         {
176            final Primitive triStrip = new TriangleStrip();
177            for (int j = 0; j < k; ++j) // choose a line of longitude
178            {
179               triStrip.addIndex((1+i)* k + j);  // v[i+1][j]
180               triStrip.addIndex(   i * k + j);  // v[i  ][j]
181            }
182            triStrip.addIndex((1+i)* k + 0);  // v[i+1][0]
183            triStrip.addIndex(   i * k + 0);  // v[i  ][0]
184            addPrimitive(triStrip);
185         }
186      }
187      else if (MeshType.VERTICAL == type)
188      {
189         for (int j = 0; j < k - 1; ++j) // choose a line of longitude
190         {
191            final Primitive triStrip = new TriangleStrip();
192            triStrip.addIndex(topCenterIndex);
193            for (int i = 0; i < n; ++i) // choose a circle of latitude
194            {
195               triStrip.addIndex(i * k + j+1);  // v[i][j+1]
196               triStrip.addIndex(i * k + j);    // v[i][j  ]
197            }
198            triStrip.addIndex(bottomCenterIndex);
199            addPrimitive(triStrip);
200         }
201         // Last vertical strip to close the frustum.
202         final Primitive triStrip = new TriangleStrip();
203         triStrip.addIndex(topCenterIndex);
204         for (int i = 0; i < n; ++i) // choose a circle of latitude
205         {
206            triStrip.addIndex(i * k + 0);    // v[i][0  ]
207            triStrip.addIndex(i * k + k-1);  // v[i][k-1]
208         }
209         triStrip.addIndex(bottomCenterIndex);
210         addPrimitive(triStrip);
211      }
212      else // MeshType.CHECKER triangle strips
213      {
214         for (int i = 0; i < n - 1; ++i) // choose a circle of latitude
215         {
216            for (int j = 0; j < k - 1; ++j) // choose a line of longitude
217            {
218               addPrimitive(
219                  new TriangleStrip((1+i)* k + j,       // v[i+1][j  ]
220                                       i * k + j,       // v[i  ][j  ]
221                                    (1+i)* k + j + 1,   // v[i+1][j+1]
222                                       i * k + j + 1)); // v[i  ][j+1]
223            }
224            addPrimitive(
225               new TriangleStrip((1+i)* k + k - 1, // v[i+1][k-1]
226                                    i * k + k - 1, // v[i  ][k-1]
227                                 (1+i)* k + 0,     // v[i+1][0  ]
228                                    i * k + 0));   // v[i  ][0  ]
229         }
230      }
231
232      if ( MeshType.HORIZONTAL == type
233        || MeshType.CHECKER == type )
234      {
235         // Create the triangle fan at the top.
236         final Primitive topFan = new TriangleFan();
237         topFan.addIndex(topCenterIndex);
238         for (int j = k - 1; j >= 0; --j) // choose a line of longitude
239         {
240             topFan.addIndex( j ); // v[0][j]
241         }
242         topFan.addIndex( k-1 );   // v[0][k-1]
243         addPrimitive(topFan);
244
245         // Create the triangle fan at the bottom.
246         final Primitive botFan = new TriangleFan();
247         botFan.addIndex(bottomCenterIndex);
248         for (int j = 0; j < k; ++j) // choose a line of longitude
249         {
250            botFan.addIndex( ((n-1)*k)+j ); // v[n-1][j]
251         }
252         botFan.addIndex( ((n-1)*k)+0 );    // v[n-1][0]
253         addPrimitive(botFan);
254      }
255   }
256
257
258
259   // Implement the MeshMaker_TP interface (four methods).
260   @Override public int getHorzCount() {return n;}
261
262   @Override public int getVertCount() {return k;}
263
264   @Override public MeshType getType() {return type;}
265
266   @Override
267   public ConeFrustum remake(final int n, final int k, final MeshType type)
268   {
269      return new ConeFrustum(this.r1, this.r2,
270                             this.h,
271                             n, k,
272                             type);
273   }
274}//ConeFrustum
